physical_appearance:The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a lady and  female child. The lady is sitting down while the child is standing to her right. Both of them are wearing their ethnic costumes. The lady is sitting beside a pillar

sgcool_label_text:This studio photograph shows a nyonya and a girl with a table between them. This photograph was probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.\r\n\r\nG.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert
 who was originally from Dresden
 Germany. Popular among the elites
 the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This studio photograph shows a nyonya and a girl with a table between them. This photograph was probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
